page.title: 17Flora and fauna
page.content: In our block we have many forests and fields where a variety as wildlife live. On a mountain opposite our school we have 2 forests, 1 of these is a forest of pines, planted to spell the word "JIF".Within this forest buzzards and sparrowhawks, have nested as well as the usual variety of birds such as Jackdaws, Crows, Blackbirds, Finches etc. Rabbits & Hares are quite common, as are foxes. Oaks and sycamore are native to this district as were the elms of 10 years ago. In a recent line transect and quadrant study at school we found buttercups, thistles, nettles, daises, moss, ferns and clover as well as the occational dock.
